original:
Affinity Selection Mass Spectrometry (AS-MS) is a powerful technique for identifying small molecules that bind to target proteins in an unbiased manner. This method allows for the discovery of compounds that may act beyond traditional active sites, including allosteric modulators and chemical chaperones, all within a single assay.

One of the key advantages of AS-MS is its ability to identify small molecules based on their exact mass, e
